rev.comment: nevermind, I can fix this one
remove [[Image:ComeAsYouAre.ogg]]; no fair use rationale on the image description page required by WP:NFCC content criteria 10c
/* Packaging */ DOB not relevant to article (we know jhe was 3 months old) and is invasion of privacy for the person.
/* Critical reception */ added ref to recent poll of top albums

The Super Deluxe also inlcudes the Nevermind music videos
Added French albums chart with reference for Deluxe edition
moved sections around so the order makes more sense
/* 2011 Deluxe Edition */ track summary was wrong. I own this edition and there is no separate track for Endless, Nameless. It is attached to Something in the Way
rv: No one cares about who is blogging what. There will be NO links to copyrighted material. EVER.
rv: If you ripped it then you are a pirate. Go away and do not readd links to illegally-shared music. Also removing some recent IP twaddle, mucking around with names and links
Removed download links to CDs for the 20th aniv. re-release. Its is on spotify for £5 a month, FFS.
American band, american article. No Britspeak desired.

It's true, but is not established by the source. Luckily I know of a source that can provide the fact; just need to check out the book again.
/* Release */ I don't see why that link was removed
Restore wikilinks, remove unnecessary cite for something that's a summary of one of the article sections.
Grunge is a more specific type of alt-rock
Revert tracklist. Even if you had to add the template (which is not mandatory) why only add it to part of the tracklist?
/* Track listing */ Because I've figured out it is either 3:50 or 3:47 in length

added [[Category:Albums certified platinum by the Canadian Recording Industry Association]] using [[WP:HC|HotCat]]
added [[Category:Albums certified multi-platinum by the Recording Industry Association of America]] using [[WP:HC|HotCat]]
ce and some reverting--sales certifications are perfect data for tabulating and this is certainly incomplete; putting it all in prose would be an eyesore
/* Track listing */ Redundant to paragraph earlier in article

I described what guitars Kurt Cobain and Krist Novoselic used to record the Landmark album, “Nevermind"
Added Paul Carlsen who was hired to fix Curbains acoustic guitar, vocals and cello using groundbreaking digital techniques.

fix portals, brackets, typos, dates, links, references, categories, formatting and persondata, replaced: ==References== *''Classic Albums—Nirvana: Nevermind'' [DVD]. Isis Productions, 2004. *Azerrad, Michael. ''Com using [[Project:AWB|AWB]] (7602)

Grunge is a specific form of alt-rock, and not punk
